properties.name: A&A Bakery
properties.description: Posted by ThejamesA&A BakeryFilipino Bakery Nice, friendly lady seems to run this shop that has Filipino take-out food, various Filipino confectionaries, baked goods, etc... but no "normal" bread? Tried: Deep Fried Cabbage: so goods! Cabbage tempura... or more like cabbage fritadas (Italian deep fried thingies) to me... eaten with a ponzu-like sauce. Cheese Bread: Like a bun with a stick of string cheese in it... gooder than it sounds! Chicken Stew (takeout): looks kinda like curry, strongly seasoned, and the taste is what I had been wanting to cook myself, and had imagined on some occasions, haha. Beef Stew (takeout): looks like beef burgandy or whatever stew... good taste, but I didn\'t like the way the beef was cut, which made for a difficult chewing experience. If you\'re lucky, you\'ll get pieces of beef liver, too :9 Want to Try: Other take out dishes Dried anchovies, said to be eaten with soy sauce and lemon kinda mix (prolly that ponzu-like sauce) I also happen to have a tab going on here... hope there\'s no interest!!!

properties.name: Buca de Peppo
properties.description: Posted by Thejames

properties.name: Cali Cafe Sandwiches
properties.description: Posted by Thejames Cali Cafe SandwichesVietnamese Sandwich Shop Awesome back-less leopard print "Roman" style couch. You must sit on it if you are waiting for your order. The shop also has interesting smoothies, whose flavors include, but are not limited to: durian(!), JACK fruit, and much, much more... The baguette that the sandwiches are served on are toasted to *perfection*. A perfect crispyness that doesn\'t destroy the roof of your mouth. Each Bahn Mi is .75, tax in. Tried: #2 - standard viet sandwich: ham, steamed meatloaf, headcheese #11 - pork shuu mai: very yummy, the shuu mai is warm and in a tomato kinda sauce, which makes the sandwich remind me of a meatball sub... Want to Try: Normal Subs... but with the Bahn Mi\'s being 2.75... might not happen anytime soon... DURIAN SMOOTHIE

properties.name: El Maguey
properties.description: Posted by Thejames[Dirty] Mexican Restaurant Pickled carrots and salsa bar are NOT free. Tried: Machaca Plate: standard fare, doesn\'t come with veggies though. Want to Try: Something from their extensive Soup menu...

properties.name: Lucky Pho (the sign just says Restaurant - it's inside of Lucky Seafood)
properties.description: Posted by Thejames Pho Restaurant They have green chopsticks, and two TVs. Tried: #16 Pho with Rare steak and Well Done steak: the BEST well-done "steak meat" I\'ve had in an order of Pho. Why? Because it wasn\'t the cuts with the nasty yellow pieces of fat attached, and didn\'t have that weird chewiness. Very tender, good cuts of well-done steak. The rare steak was good, standard fare, some pieces were much larger than what I\'d normally expect, but still very thinly sliced. Soup/broth was only decent, I like it richer than this. Hopefully the quality of the well done steak wasn\'t just a fluke... will have to try again to make sure. Oh yeah, this place has not only large sizes, but EXTRA LARGE for just a quarter on top of the price for a large!

properties.name: Lucky Seafood [Supermarket] Takeout
properties.description: Posted by ThejamesLucky SeaA Vietnamese-run takeout food operation within a supermarket (analogous to the 99ranch takeout counters, I suppose) The food is mostly Chinese-like, nothing specifically Viet-cuisine, that I could recall. For your "big compartment" filler item, you can choose any mix of: fried rice, chow mein, fried wide rice noodle (chow fun?), and fried vermicelli (the thin kind). Personally, I think the fried vermicelli tastes the best. Food volume is comparable to Sam-Woo takeout, standard 3 compartment (2x small 1x large) take out box, pretty much filled to the top. Though the take out is "loaded", I didn\'t feel as explosively full as I would after finishing it as I would have with Sam-Woo takeout... a good thing, I suppose. For the third item, they will use a separate cup kind of container, a large and small size - depending on the dish you choose. Tried: Curry Chicken: standard Chinese-style curried chicken parts. The potato chunks were HUGE, and very yummy. Stir Fried Fish and Squid: has cucumbers in it too, not bad, kinda too salty Broccoli Beef : standard fare Mini Salmon Steak piece: submerged in some thick sauce, kinda like teriyaki sauce... not bad, could do with less sauce, though Some Tofu Dish: can\'t remember what it was... maybe with seafood? Want to Try: Rice Noodle Lunch Kit: prepackaged dry (w/o soup) rice noodle meal kit thing... kinda like 冷やし中華... but with rice noodles, and probably has peanut sauce (or is that a Thai thing?)
